DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Performed Observation Outcome Occurrence Date and Time Range Sentinel CDM Death Imputed Date Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation._When DeathDt is imputed, this variable indicates which parts of the date were imputed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Performed Observation Outcome Occurrence Date and Time Range
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
Executed and carried through to completion.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.

Property.preferredDefinition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.
An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released per model owner approval. mc 6/2013

ValueDomain.preferredName: Sentinel CDM Death Imputed Date Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: When DeathDt is imputed, this variable indicates which parts of the date were imputed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One and the other; relating to or being two in conjunction.: An imputed date that includes the month and day of observation.

Concepts.definition: One and the other; relating to or being two in conjunction.
An imputed date that includes the month and day of observation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An imputed date that includes the day of observation.

Concepts.definition: An imputed date that includes the day of observation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An imputed date that includes the month of observation.

Concepts.definition: An imputed date that includes the month of observation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: The calendar date of the observation that is imputed.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The calendar date of the observation that is imputed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: Sentinel CDM:The Sentinel Common Data Model

DataElement.origin: Sentinel CDM:The Sentinel Common Data Model
DataElement.changeDescription: Based on CDMH BRIDG 5.0.2 and Sentinel value set for CDM.
